thread.title: CT student makes Mt Kilimanjaro history
thread.title_full: CT student makes Mt Kilimanjaro history

author: Megan Ellis
title: CT student makes Mt Kilimanjaro history
text:
Need a flight? We'll scan dozens of airlines and get you the best fare in seconds! CT student makes Mt Kilimanjaro history Article By: Megan Ellis Thu, 03 Sep 2015 3:45 PM Share Your Email Chaeli Mycroft. Credit: Byron Keulemans 
Cape Town student Chaeli Mycroft has become the first female quadriplegic to summit Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania. 
Chaeli is an ability activist who co-founded The Chaeli Campaign . 
"After watching the stationary tracker for what feels like hours we have received confirmation from Discover Africa that 7 climbers, including Chaeli, reached Uhuru Peak between 07h28 and 08h37," Chaeli's mother and CEO of The Chaeli Campaign Zelda Mycroft said on the Discover Africa site . 
Chaeli was accompanied by a team of climbers. 
They achieved their goal of climbing the mountain in only seven days. 
But what was the aim of the climb? 
To raise funds in support of The Chaeli Campaign's Inclusive Education Programme and The Chaeli Cottage Inclusive Preschool and Enrichment Centre. 
Finally reaching the summit, Chaeli and her team's efforts have proved to be fruitful. Related Articles
